eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks can be used the same way as physical gamepads:
- 4 or 8 directions
- Analogus pads
- Player selection
- Controls mapping for top-down movement and platformer characters
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Delay the camera according to a maximum speed and catch up the delay.
eventsFunctions.name: WaitAndCatchUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delay the camera of _PARAM0_ during: _PARAM2_ seconds according to the maximum speed _PARAM3_;_PARAM4_ seconds and catch up in _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Maybe the catch-up show be done in constant pixel speed instead of constant time speed.

eventsFunctions.description: Update delayed position and delayed history. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateDelayedPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update delayed position and delayed history of _PARAM0_

events.comment: Add the previous position to have enough (2) positions to evaluate the extra delay for waiting mode.
Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.name: AddForecastHistoryPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add the time:_PARAM2_ and position: _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ to the forecast history of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful.
Keep at least 2 positions because no forecast can be done with less positions.

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX))
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY))
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ForecastTimeRatio

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
There are ready-to-use resource bars in the asset-store [resource bars pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=resource-bars-resource-bars).

changelog.breaking: - Resource bars now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing resource bars in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor of instances of an object.
It handles:
- Damage cooldown
- Health and shield regeneration
- Over healing
It can be used on:
- Players
- Enemies
- NPCs
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectSpawner
description: Spawn objects periodically based on the 2D location of the spawner.
If "random position" is enabled, objects will spawn in a random position inside the spawner object.
This allows the size of the spawner object to define an area where objects will spawn.
It can be used to create:
- Enemies
- NPCs
- Environmental objects

eventsFunctions.description: Spawn (create) objects periodically. This action must be run every frame to work. When the max quantity is reached and an instance is deleted, the spawner waits the duration of the spawn period before creating another instance. Spawned objects are automatically linked to the spawner.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a straight line.
description: Move objects on a straight line or according to their angle.

It can be used for simple enemies or bullets. It's usually not adapted for players (other behaviors are a better choice) or bullets fired with the actions provided by the "Fire Bullet" behavior (these bullets are already moved using a force).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TwoChoicesDialogBoxes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A dialog box with buttons to let users make a choice.
description: A dialog box showing multiple options (usually "yes" and "no") and a customizable text message.
It handles keyboard, gamepad and touch controls.
There are ready-to-use dialog boxes in the asset-store [dialog boxes pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=dialog-boxes-dialog-boxes).

Gamepad, mouse, touch and keyboard are fully supported.
Each action from a device increment or decrement an index that is used to focus the active button, make outlines and trigger a sound effect.
To escape the dialog we can focus the button with the identifier 1 which is usually the button to cancel/deny by pressing one of the key or buttons

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other physical controllers).
It gives access to:
- button presses,
- axis positions and force,
- trigger pressure,
- configurable deadzone,
- vibration,

- automatic "gamepad mapper" behaviors for 2D and 3D movement behaviors (platformer characters, top-down movement, 3D character etc...). Add one of these to the object with the movement behavior (i.e: the player most of the time) and the behavior will then be controlled automatically by the gamepad (it works by reading the gamepad state and simulating controls). No need for additional events to make it work once the behaviors are set up.
The Bomberman-like example handles 4 players with gamepads ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://goose-bomberman)).

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of the deadzone applied to a gamepad sticks, between 0 and 1.

eventsFunctions.description: Set the deadzone for sticks of the gamepad. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved). Deadzone is between 0 and 1, and is by default 0.2.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Set_deadzone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set deadzone for sticks on gamepad: _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.description: Deadzone for sticks, 0.2 by default (0 to 1)
parameters.name: deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a stick of a gamepad is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Axis_pushed
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM2_ stick of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

inlineCode: console.error('Parameter stick in condition: "Gamepad stick pushed (axis)", is not valid, must be LEFT or RIGHT');
console.error('Parameter direction in condition: "Gamepad stick pushed (axis)", is not valid, must be UP, DOWN, LEFT or RIGHT');

eventsFunctions.description: Return the number of connected gamepads.
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectedGamepadsCount

inlineCode: // Gamepads can be disconnected and become null

eventsFunctions.description: Return a string containing informations about the specified gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: GamepadType

inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = (gamepad && gamepad.id) ? gamepad.id : "No information for player " + (playerId + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified gamepad has the specified information in its description. Useful to know if the gamepad is a Xbox or PS4 controller.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_type

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a gamepad is connected.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_X_is_connected

inlineCode: // If gamepad was disconnected it will be null (so this will return false)
// If gamepad was never connected it will be undefined (so this will return false)

eventsFunctions.description: Generate a vibration on the specified controller. Might only work if the game is running in a recent web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Vibrate_controller

inlineCode: //Vibration work only on game in browser.

parameters.description: Time of the vibration, in seconds (optional, default value is 1)
parameters.name: Duration

eventsFunctions.description: Generate an advanced vibration on the specified controller. Incompatible with Firefox.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Advanced_Vibration_Controller
eventsFunctions.sentence: Make gamepad _PARAM1_ vibrate for _PARAM2_ seconds with the vibration magnitude of _PARAM3_ and _PARAM4_

inlineCode: //Vibration work only on game in browser.

parameters.description: Time of the vibration, in seconds (optional, default value is 1)
parameters.name: Duration

eventsFunctions.description: Change a vibration on the specified controller. Incompatible with Firefox.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Change_Vibration_Magnitude
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the vibration magnitude of _PARAM2_ & _PARAM3_ on gamepad _PARAM1_

inlineCode: //Vibration work only on game in browser.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_any_button_released
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is released

eventsFunctions.description: Return the strength of the weak vibration motor on the gamepad of a player.
eventsFunctions.name: WeakVibrationMagnitude

eventsFunctions.description: Return the strength of the strong vibration motor on the gamepad of a player.
eventsFunctions.name: StrongVibrationMagnitude
